posts.post_content:
Ultimate land Fix, this is why its banned.  
4 [Mox Emerald](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mox Emerald)   
4 [Mox Jet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mox Jet)   
4 [Mox Pearl](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mox Pearl)   
4 [Mox Ruby](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mox Ruby)   
4 [Mox Sapphire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mox Sapphire)   
4 [Black Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Lotus)  
4 [Tolarian Academy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tolarian Academy)   
  
Imagine on T1 you pull 3 moxes, a lotus, and an academy. Thats 10 mana and you would be doing shit like that all the time. Just make every deck you play run this and insane broken card atvantage.

Posted By: TheWrathofShane (7/8/2010 1:12:18 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Weber, it's nice to see you started playing Magic TODAY and haven't learned a thing yet. I said almost the same thing back in early 1994. I was like "Wow they do the same thing as a Land why do they cost 25 dollars each???" and then, I went to a tournament, and got stomped because my opponent dropped on his first turn two moxes, a Land, and time Walk which he managed to Fork, then, he dropped out a Wheel of Fortune, got Regrowth and another Mox, dropped all of it, on the table, Forked another Time Walk, and casted ONE Prodigal Sorcerer, which does a direct damage to any target. He killed me with that card as I was able to take ONE turn before losing.
  
   
It's one thing to think stupid the month you start playing, it's another to have your butt handed to you by someone who knows better and uses these. The reason Moxes and Black Lotus cost so much money for doing the same thing as a basic land, is because they add SPEED. What deck doesn't work better when it's faster? All decks in every g... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Ideatog (7/26/2010 10:23:30 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I played with my friend and he warned me not to try anything funny. My deck's got no [Mox](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mox)es, no [Time Walk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Walk)s or [Black Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Lotus)es. My deck has many regenerating cards and also hybrids from Eventide, including the scary [Deathbringer Liege](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathbringer Liege). My friend played a White/Blue deck. So we played. I played a [Swamp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swamp) and a [Nip Gwyllion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nip Gwyllion). Then it was my opponent's turn. He played a [Mox Pearl](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mox Pearl) and a [Mox Sapphire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mox Sapphire) and a [Plains](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Plains) and proceeded to play a [Time Walk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Walk). He took an extra turn and played an [Island](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Island) and a [Phantom Monster](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phantom Monster). Turn 2 I played a [Swamp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swamp) and a [Edge of the Divinity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Edge of the Divinity) and [Unholy Strength](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unholy Strength) on the Gwyllion to make it into a 6/5 lifelink powerhouse and attacked. My opponent's turn two he played a P... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

My deck has many regenerating cards and also hybrids from Eventide, including the scary Deathbringer Liege. My friend played a White/Blue deck. So we played. I played a Swamp and a Nip Gwyllion. Then it was my opponent's turn. He played a Mox Pearl and a Mox Sapphire and a Plains and proceeded to play a Time Walk. He took an extra turn and played an Island and a Phantom Monster. Turn 2 I played a Swamp and a Edge of the Divinity and Unholy Strength on the Gwyllion to make it into a 6/5 lifelink powerhouse and attacked. My opponent's turn two he played a P... (see all)
